document.heading: District of Columbia Funds Control Act of 1980

history.narrative: Law 3-104, the “District of Columbia Funds Control Act of 1980,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 3-169, which was referred to the Committee of the Whole. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 17, 1980 and July 1, 1980, respectively. Disapproved by the Mayor on July 22, 1980, but re-enacted on July 29, 1980, it was assigned Act No. 3-229 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
